reasoning: Failure to thrive is a clinical diagnosis based on inadequate weight gain, affecting approximately 7.5% of infants globally (prevalence metric). Incidence not well-defined as it's a symptom rather than discrete disease. Higher in developing countries due to malnutrition and infections; lower in developed countries. Confidence moderate due to definitional variations and heterogeneous etiologies.
source: WHO Child Growth Standards (2006); Pediatric epidemiological cohort studies on infant malnutrition and growth
